com.webcheckers.ui

Class WebServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.webcheckers.ui.WebServer

  • public class WebServer
extends java.lang.Object
    The server that initializes the set of HTTP request handlers. This defines the web application interface for this WebCheckers application. There are multiple ways in which you can have the client issue a request and the application generate responses to requests. If your team is not careful when designing your approach, you can quickly create a mess where no one can remember how a particular request is issued or the response gets generated. Aim for consistency in your approach for similar activities or requests.

    Design choices for how the client makes a request include:
    • Request URL
    • HTTP verb for request (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE and so on)
    • Optional: Inclusion of request parameters

    Design choices for generating a response to a request include:
    • View templates with conditional elements
    • Use different view templates based on results of executing the client request
    • Redirecting to a different application URL

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebServer

        public WebServer(spark.TemplateEngine templateEngine,
                 com.google.gson.Gson gson,
                 GameCenter gameCenter,
                 PlayerLobby playerLobby)
        The constructor for the Web Server.
        Parameters:
        templateEngine - The default TemplateEngine to render page-level HTML views.
        gson - The default Gson parser for Route handlers.
        gameCenter - the default GameCenter for tracking all ongoing games
        playerLobby - the default PlayerLobby for tracking all players
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If any of the parameters are null.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initialize all of the HTTP routes that make up this web application.

        GameInit of the web server includes defining the location for static files, and defining all routes for processing client requests. The method returns after the web server finishes its initialization.
